t: Job 11
Then*p answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
Should*p not the multitude of words be answered? and should a man full of talk be justified?
Should*p thy lies make men hold their peace? and when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
For*p thou hast said, My doctrine is pure, and I am clean in thine eyes.
But*p oh that God would speak, and open his lips against thee;
And*p that he would shew thee the secrets of wisdom, that they are double to that which is! Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
Canst*p thou by searching find out God? canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
It*p is as high as heaven; what canst thou do? deeper than hell; what canst thou know?
The*p measure thereof is longer than the earth, and broader than the sea.
If*p he cut off, and shut up, or gather together, then who can hinder him?
For*p he knoweth vain men: he seeth wickedness also; will he not then consider it?
For*p vain man would be wise, though man be born like a wild ass's colt.
If*p thou prepare thine heart, and stretch out thine hands toward him;
If*p iniquity be in thine hand, put it far away, and let not wickedness dwell in thy tabernacles.
For*p then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
Because*p thou shalt forget thy misery, and remember it as waters that pass away:
And*p thine age shall be clearer than the noonday; thou shalt shine forth, thou shalt be as the morning.
And*p thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; yea, thou shalt dig about thee, and thou shalt take thy rest in safety.
Also*p thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
But*p the eyes of the wicked shall fail, and they shall not escape, and their hope shall be as the giving up of the ghost.
